author: USA TODAY
title: Grammys: The eight worst dressed
text:
Grammys: The eight worst dressed Erin Jensen, USA TODAY Published 10:12 p.m. ET Feb. 12, 2017 | Updated 1 minute ago 
While the Grammy Awardss highlight music's biggest moments of the year, Sunday's red carpet was not without a few sour notes. Here are the stars who looked less than acca-awesome. 1. CeeLo Green 
CeeLo loves gold! (Photo: Dan MacMedan-USA TODAY NETWORK) 
Twitter had a field day with this gilded ensemble and face mask. From comparisons to Ferrero Rocher candy to " a villain from an unaired Power Rangers episode," his monochromatic look was just too much. 
We consider this look a scratch. (Photo: Dan MacMedan-USA TODAY NETWORK) 
While it's certainly an interesting way to repurpose old CDs after digitizing one's music collection, it's more kitsch than clever. 3. Girl Crush 
Ballin' outta control. (Photo: Dan MacMedan-USA TODAY NETWORK) 
This look is the answer to what would happen if you jumped into a ball pit wearing a skirt made of super glue. 4. Lady Gaga 
Mother Monster. (Photo: Dan MacMedan-USA TODAY NETWORK) 
Lady Gaga has made a career out of doing the most on the red carpet, and we applaud her body confidence. But her biker chic ensemble was just a little over the top. 
She's just prepping you for all the flowers you'll see in your newsfeed this week. (Photo: Dan MacMedan-USA TODAY NETWORK) 
King showed us what happens when you awake from a bed of roses, but you have static cling. On the positive side, the Ex's & Oh's singer tweeted on Jan. 23 that she wanted to "get on every WORST dressed list," so at least King is one of the few keeping her New Year's resolutions. 6. Halsey 
Let's put this look to bed. (Photo: Alberto E. Rodriguez, Getty Images for NARAS) 
Don't go chasing Waterfalls or iconic looks that are really ambitious. The Closer singer said her blue ensemble was inspired by the iconic styles of TLC and Aaliyah, but it seems a bit out of her reach. 7. Nick Jonas 
Urban Cow-brah. (Photo: John Shearer, WireImage) 
The Close singer's Balmain jacket is on trend... for furniture. Who isn't coveting a headboard or chair with nailheads at the moment? 8. Kirstin Maldonado 
Kirstin Maldonado, second from left. (Photo: John Shearer, WireImage) 
The striped ensemble that the Pentatonix singer donned was not beautiful, a capella music to our eyes. Facebook
